@btmcgraw23 @joesonka There are millions of background checks performed each month, so you can see why some gun safety advocates argue that three-day window could be problematic. Also, in many states, background checks aren't needed for private sales. The story goes into greater detail on that.

@btmcgraw23 @joesonka Hi, I wrote this story. It goes into detail about all the ways guns are easily acquired. But quickly: Background checks are only required when buying a gun from a licensed dealer, and even then, the sale can go ahead if the check isn't completed in 3 business days.

urls.title: It’s been a year since the Kentucky tornadoes. For some in Mayfield, recovery far from over
urls.description: In July, the state's attention turned to the killing floods in Eastern Kentucky, but the wounds remained for many who survived in the candle factory.

tweets.text:
In the third and final part of By Candlelight, we learn what's happened to each of the tornado survivors @jrbullington followed this year.

Prepare for a rollercoaster ride of emotions...
https://t.co/pAEq4lreVC

"They always say if you can build a house and still remain married, you've got a pretty strong marriage. But this is No. 2 in less than three years. ... There's just something mentally. I know neither one of us want to ever go through that again."

https://t.co/RlJLoia7u4

urls.title: 'We are going to come back from this': New homes rise after devastating Kentucky tornadoes
urls.description: Rebuilding homes after tornadoes swept through Kentucky on Dec. 10-11, 2021, has been slow. But residents see hope in their communities' progress.

urls.title: They survived the tornado that leveled the Mayfield candle factory. That was just the beginning
urls.description: For three women who were trapped in the wreckage of the Mayfield Consumer Products factory, the trauma of that night remains fresh now one year later.

tweets.text:
Highly recommend this powerful @jrbullington series following 3 rescued Mayfield candle factory employees for a year after the tornado.

“I wish I could be over it. I wish more than anything I could be over it. I’m just stuck. Time goes on. But I don’t.”

https://t.co/eDEAhjlizD

urls.title: They survived the tornado that leveled the Mayfield candle factory. That was just the beginning
urls.description: For three women who were trapped in the wreckage of the Mayfield Consumer Products factory, the trauma of that night remains fresh now one year later.

urls.title: Louisville police get an early warning system to flag at-risk officers. Will it help?
urls.description: The launch of the intervention system comes about 1 1/2 years after it was promised in a settlement with Breonna Taylor's family.

tweets.text:
After years of delays, LMPD’s early intervention system meant to flag Louisville officers possibly at risk for misconduct/in need of support is finally operating.

Here’s how it works. (Thanks to Lt. Lopez, Sgt. Miller, others for the time.)

https://t.co/DvWNW6jdEd w/@NewsQuip

urls.title: 'Vindication': Breonna Taylor's family, supporters celebrate federal charges against cops
urls.description: "Today's overdue, but it still hurts," Breonna Taylor's mother, Tamika Palmer, said of the federal indictments against LMPD officers.

tweets.text:
After another gun massacre of children, Sen. Mitch McConnell faces pressure to act in Senate.

This seems like a really good day to bring back this important project: https://t.co/BLaBBBTUnJ via @jrbullington #AwashInGuns

@jrbullington @joesonka That is something I wasn’t aware of, I’d say because when purchasing my handguns my background check came back instantly. With that said, that is a huge issue, especially for private sales. I also appreciate your response.

@btmcgraw23 @joesonka Hi, I wrote this story. It goes into detail about all the ways guns are easily acquired. But quickly: Background checks are only required when buying a gun from a licensed dealer, and even then, the sale can go ahead if the check isn't completed in 3 business days.
@joesonka @jrbullington Yep, someone answering the question who knows the answer.

urls.title: A Louisville cop hit a protester on a night of 'pure chaos.' Now he's going to prison
urls.description: Former Louisville Officer Cory Evans bludgeoned a kneeling protester on the back of the head with a wooden riot stick and then lied to his superiors.

It's been almost a month since tornadoes left widespread destruction across Western Kentucky.

The @courierjournal is not done covering its impact on people and communities. https://t.co/lGNJJDXRdK

Breaking: Several survivors of the Mayfield Consumer Products candle factory collapse will sue the company, attorney Amos Jones told me.

"We have identified 6 causes of action before, during and after the tornado. We will be filing formally very soon."
https://t.co/26qPTEyQ4N

Inside the final shift at the Mayfield candle factory. 

"I’ve been shaking since I walked out of the rubble. It was horrific." 

https://t.co/5LtErjVHQU Story w/ @jrbullington, @Ben__Tobin and @chris_kenning

Hear from Mayfield candle factory workers.

"I can't sleep. The only thing I hear is everyone's screams."

“If I would have gone home, would I still be alive?”

“People were just kind of sitting in the rubble, crying."

"They should have sent us home.”

https://t.co/6JrfO6AIjR

The state is working to confirm statements from the candle factory that 94 workers survived, a big difference from Gov. Beshear's initial statements.

Have family who worked in the factory? ¿Su familiar trabajaba en la fábrica? Contact @Ben__Tobin, @jrbullington, @MattMencarini.

There have been more than 550 “non-life-threatening” shootings in Louisville so far this year, and they usually get about three sentences. But that’s not where the story ends for victims. Another really strong piece from @jrbullington: https://t.co/K7jt23cvqH

My dad, the original Gregory Royal Pratt, died last night. He went peacefully after a hard cancer fight. I went to see him in Tennessee over the weekend and am glad I got to tell him I love him. My cousin is raising money for his wife, who is a saint.  
https://t.co/jDyL0otkQe

urls.title: Louisville is sacrificing poor schools to ensure its elite magnet programs thrive
urls.description: Louisville's magnet program should have boosted school diversity. Instead, it created a system of "haves" and "have-nots" that shut out the poor.

tweets.text: Definitely one of the most ambitious projects I’ve ever helped along: 6 parts, a mini documentary, many strong images and graphics and a 6-part podcast. Immensely proud of the work by @mandy_mclaren and all those who brought it to the finish line. 1/5 https://t.co/8DnM5Cq4mN

Several things stopped them: Fear over the vaccine. Lack of transportation. Too busy. But they finally got their shots. 

From myself and @d_yetter : 

https://t.co/zEwnh2tEGc

I spent a morning with Louisville paramedics and EMTs. Don Scheer tells me he sees around 2 to 3 COVID cases per shift. They're younger than last year.   He'll ask if they vaxxed, they'll so no but "I’m getting it here while I’m in this hospital." https://t.co/2qhpGlxvH0

Have you lost a loved one to COVID-19? 

Share your story with @ladd_sarah 

https://t.co/zQEbsCEuGs

Professional news: Today marks my first day as a breaking news reporter for the @courierjournal! 

Montgomery has been an amazing experience for me - I've learned so much over the past 3 years and I'm very excited to be joining such a talented team in Louisville.

A previous in-custody death. "Dangerous" overcrowding. Filthy living conditions. Racist treatment of BIPOC prisoners. Negligent medical care. Repeated strip-searches.

These are some of the accusations levied at the Jackson County, Ind., jail where Ta'Neasha Chappell died. https://t.co/uvBO6loiER
@jrbullington Jonathan: Love to see you apply for John Jay webinar on gun violence prevention. Deadline is August 2. https://t.co/09j64g6iC3  email me at mauricepossley@gmail.com

@SadiqaReynolds @catherinemekus @MomsDemand @HannahDrake628 "Guns don't just shoot themselves. The triggers are pulled by people who are desperate, people who don't have basic needs met." @jecoreyarthur
@SadiqaReynolds @catherinemekus @MomsDemand "It makes it almost laughable the police take guns from the street only to resell them for profit later." @HannahDrake628
